Barcelona will start the season with a new President after [[Joan Laporta]] reached his term limit on 30 June, leaving behind a very [[Joan Laporta#Trophies won by club during presidency|successful club tenure]]. [[Sandro Rosell]] was [[List of FC Barcelona presidents|elected President]] on 13 June by securing a record total of 35,021 votes (61.35%), more than the 27,138 achieved by Laporta in 2003. Rosell began his tenure on 1 July as the 39th President in Barcelona's history.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/destacades/n100613111585.html |title=Rosell voted president |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-06-13 |accessdate=2010-06-14}} ==Season overview== ===June=== Barcelona started their transfer window only three days after the end of the [[2009â10 FC Barcelona season|2009-10 season]], by reaching an agreement with [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] for [[Spain national football team|Spanish international]] [[David Villa]] worth â¬40 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/destacades/n100519111099.html |title=Villa signed |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-05-19 |accessdate=2010-05-19}} On 30 June, [[Xavier Sala-i-Martin]], treasurer and director in charge of the economic area, announced that Barcelona reached a record â¬445.5 million in revenues during the 2009-10 season. According to Xavier, "that's the highest revenues achieved by any club, in any sport including the U.S." This means FC Barcelona is the richest club in the world in terms of revenues.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.es/web/castellano/noticies/club/temporada09-10/06/30/n100630111815.html |title=Record Revenues |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-06-30 |accessdate=2010-06-14}} ===July=== Coach [[Pep Guardiola]] later expressed disapproval of the transfer of Chygrynskiy indicating he was pressed to let him go. Speaking at a press-conference Guardiola said: "My opinion counts, but the needs of the club go above that and that's why he was sold, I would like to have kept him." Speaking on TourÃ©, Guardiola said he would have preferred him to stay, but the player was set on moving.{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11679_6270297,00.html |title=Guardiola wanted TourÃ© stay |publisher=SkySports.com |date=19 July 2010 |accessdate=14 August 2010}} On 14 July, [[Thierry Henry]] and Barcelona agreed to rescind his contract in order for Henry to become a free agent, where he subsequently signed a new four-and-a-half year contract with [[Major League Soccer]]'s [[New York Red Bulls]]. He stated, "This is a new and exciting chapter in my career."{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/07/14/n100714112016.html |title=Henry ends his Barcelona career |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-07-14 |accessdate=2010-07-15}} The club also agreed with [[Josep Guardiola]] on a one-year extension to stay as coach of the first team, along with long-time assistant [[Tito Vilanova]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/07/14/n100714112011.html |title=Guardiola signs for another year |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-07-16 |accessdate=2010-07-14}} ===August=== On 27 August, Barcelona reached an agreement with [[England|English]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for the services of [[Argentina national football team|Argentine international]] [[Javier Mascherano]]. The deal was worth â¬24 million and was reached "after considerable effort from the club (Barcelona) over the last few hours and the willingness and desire of the player to make the move."{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/08/27/n100827112582.html |title=Mascherano completes move to Barcelona |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-08-27 |accessdate=2010-08-27}} On the same day, the executive committee of the FC Barcelona board of directors publicly "denounced the conduct over the last few days of the agent of our player [[Zlatan IbrahimoviÄ]], [[Mino Raiola]], whose declarations have put into question the honour and moral integrity of our coach Josep Guardiola." The club's legal department considered the possibility of rescinding the contract and the cessation of the annual payment Mr. Raiola's company receives from the club as part of their agreement.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/club/temporada10-11/08/27/n100827112591.html |title=Barcelona official communication |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-08-27 |accessdate=2010-08-27}} The next day, Barcelona and [[Italy|Italian]] club [[A.C. Milan|AC Milan]] agreed to a one-year loan for the [[Sweden national football team|Swedish international]] with Milan paying all his earnings for the 2010-11 season and including in the agreement is the option for Milan to make the move permanent next summer for a fee of â¬24 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/08/28/n100828112606.html |title=IbrahimoviÄ moves to AC Milan |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-08-28 |accessdate=2010-08-28}} ===September=== Coach Guardiola stated, "It will cost us a lot. We expect a difficult year in which things have to be won by ourselves. Right now, the team is not at full strength at this point in the season."{{cite web|url=http://www.elmundodeportivo.es/gen/20100911/54001317119/noticia/guardiola-todo-cuesta-mucho.html|title=Guardiola speaks on HÃ©rcules lose|publisher=elmundodeportive.es|language=Spanish|date=2010-09-11|accessdate=2010-09-22}} On 19 September, [[Lionel Messi]] suffered an ankle injury due to an ill-advised tackle{{cite web|url=http://estaticos01.marca.com/imagenes/2010/09/20/g2009.jpg|title=Image of tackle|publisher=Marca.com|language=Spanish|date=2010-09-20|accessdate=2010-09-22}} by [[AtlÃ©tico Madrid]] defender [[TomÃ¡Å¡ UjfaluÅ¡i]] in the 92nd minute of their Round Three match at the [[Vicente CalderÃ³n Stadium]]. At first sight, it was feared that Messi suffered a broken ankle that could have kept the star player away from the pitch for a minimum of six months, but MRIs performed the next day in [[Barcelona]] showed he suffered a sprain in the internal and external ligaments of his right ankle.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/09/20/n100920113021.html|title=Messi injured|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2010-09-20|accessdate=2010-09-22}} Teammate [[David Villa]] stated "the tackle on Messi was brutal" after watching the video of the play and also added that he believed the AtlÃ©tico defender "didn't go into the tackle to hurt."{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/09/20/n100920113025.html|title=Villa on Messi's injury|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2010-09-20|accessdate=2010-09-22}} The incident caused widespread media attention because of Messi's high profile in the football world and brought up the debate of equality in protecting all players in the game. Debates whether the fact that Messi's status prompted the intensive media and fans scrutiny of UjfaluÅ¡i and subsequent two match ban by the Competition Committee{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/09/21/n100921113046.html|title=UjfaluÅ¡i banned 2 matches|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2010-09-21|accessdate=2010-09-22}} appeared all over the internet, television, and print in the days following the incident.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=825153&cc=5901|title=Media on Messi's injury|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2010-09-20|accessdate=2010-09-22}}{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/foxsoccer/laliga/story/Messi-to-miss-two-Barca-games-with-injury|title=Media on Messi's injury|publisher=FOXSports.com|date=2010-09-20|accessdate=2010-09-22}}{{cite web|url=http://www.elmundodeportivo.es/gen/20100921/54008908249/noticia/el-comite-de-competicion-sanciona-con-dos-partidos-a-ujfalusi-por-su-entrada-a-messi.html|title=Media on Messi's injury|publisher=elmundodeportivo.es|language=Spanish|date=2010-09-20|accessdate=2010-09-22}}{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/09/21/futbol/equipos/atletico/1285082725.html|title=Media on Messi's injury|publisher=Marca.com|language=Spanish|date=2010-09-20|accessdate=2010-09-22}} ===October=== Due to the findings of the audit, Barcelona ''compromisarios'' (commissioners) voted to enforce the social action of responsibility against the clubâs previous board with 468 in favour, 439 against, and 113 abstaining.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/club/temporada10-11/10/16/n101016113446.html |title=Laporta's Board taken to court |publisher=FCBarcelona.cat |date=2010-10-16 |accessdate=2010-10-18}} Ex-President Laportaâs board will be called upon to respond in court due to â¬48.7 million that went missing during his presidency.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/10/16/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1287220897.html |title=â¬48.7 million missing during Laporta's presidency |publisher=Marca.com |language=Spanish |date=2010-10-16 |accessdate=2010-10-18}} On 18 October, Laporta defended his presidency in front of the media by stating that, "We just want them to give us the documentation regarding the biased and demagogic statement made by the representative of KPMG." He also stated, "The board has not had the courage to explain things," and "We have nothing to hide, everything has its explanation and justification." Laporta did not hold back and branded the new President "envious, resentful and jealous" and "I have a very clear conscience and the truth on my side." He continue to berate the new board by stating, "My greatest desire after spending a few years of my life at BarÃ§a and the results we got was to become a ''socio'', go back to my seat, go to football games with my kids and enjoy this club. ''They'' do not let me. And not only do they not let me, but I see some attempts to ridicule, dishonor the reputation we have. No way I'm left alone. After the assembly of delegates, I understand that there was an indecent maneuver with the exposure of the 'due diligence'.. It was sectarian, demagogic and an interest to scorn against me and create an alarm among the social mass."{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/10/18/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1287396222.html |title=Laporta defends his presidency |publisher=Marca.com |language=Spanish |date=2010-10-18 |accessdate=2010-10-18}} ===November=== On 29 November, one of the most eagerly-awaited [[el ClÃ¡sico|ClÃ¡sico]] in recent times, was scheduled on Monday due to the [[Catalonian parliamentary election, 2010|elections to the Parliament of Catalonia]], which was held on the day before. The match featured 13 of the 23 winning players on Spain's [[2010 FIFA World Cup squads#Spain|2010 FIFA World Cup squad]] and currently the two most successful managers in Pep Guardiola and [[JosÃ© Mourinho]]. The match itself was a complete domination by Barcelona, with an emphatic 5â0 trashing of their eternal rival.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=847469&sec=europe&cc=5901|title=BarÃ§a humiliate Real Madrid|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-11-30}} The game showcased BarÃ§a's mastering of the [[tiki-taka]] in combination with the [[Total Football]] philosophy and the superb team-work of whom many consider the top 3 players in the world, Messi, Xavi and Iniesta.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/columns/story?id=847433&sec=europe&root=europe&cc=5901|title=BarÃ§a simply the best|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2010-11-29|accessdate=2010-11-30}} The international press hailed Barcelona's impressive win and their football as currently the best in the game.,{{cite web|url=http://www.elmundodeportivo.es/gen/20101130/54078364748/noticia/la-revista-de-prensa-del-barsa-real-madrid.html|title=BarÃ§a hailed by press|publisher=ElMundoDeportivo.es|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-11-30}}{{cite web|url=http://sport.es/default.asp?idpublicacio_PK=44&idioma=CAS&idnoticia_PK=731680&idseccio_PK=1402|title=BarÃ§a hailed by press|publisher=Sport.es|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-11-30}}{{cite web|url=http://www.as.com/futbol/articulo/barcelona-divino-mourinho-humillado/20101129dasdasftb_57/Tes|title=BarÃ§a hailed by press|publisher=AS.com|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-11-30}}{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/11/30/fcb_madrid/n101130114320.html|title=BarÃ§a hailed by press|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-11-30}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/futbol-internacional/Barcelona-Real-Madrid-Ole_0_380962040.html|title=BarÃ§a hailed by press|publisher=Ole.com.ar|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-29|accessdate=2010-11-30}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Estero/Liga/30-11-2010/ceffone-mou-ripassata-real-711989973259.shtml|title=BarÃ§a hailed by press|publisher=Gazzetta.it|language=Italian|date=2010-11-29|accessdate=2010-11-30}} while some questioned whether the [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] squad was "ready" for the magnitude of this match.{{cite web|url=http://www.as.com/futbol/articulo/hoy-martes/20101130dasdaiftb_20/Tes|title=Mourinho defensive system fails|publisher=AS.com|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-11-30}} Guardiola stated, "it was a spectacle"{{cite web|url=http://www.elmundodeportivo.es/gen/20101130/54078986484/noticia/pep-tras-el-5-0-sed-humildes-pero-ha-sido-un-puto-espectaculo.html|title=Pep speaks on el ClÃ¡sico|publisher=ElMundodeportivo.es|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-11-30}} and "how we did it - that makes us proud. Now just let us sit back and enjoy that win - weâll reflect and look at the whole game, but now it would be wrong not to revel in the win. Games like that happen very rarely indeed".{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/11/29/fcb_madrid/n101130114313.html|title=Pep speaks on el ClÃ¡sico|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2010-10-29|accessdate=2010-11-30}} In regards to Madrid, Pep stated "this match isn't representative of the difference between the two teams. They are a very good team, they came here unbeaten and as league leaders. Today all of our players played well and that was the difference."{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=847434&sec=europe&cc=5901|title=Pep speaks on Real Madrid|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2010-10-29|accessdate=2010-11-30}} After the victory, Barcelona took over first place in La Liga's table. Ahead of Madrid by two points with 25 rounds left to play. ===December=== On 6 December, the finalists for the [[2010 FIFA Ballon d'Or|FIFA Ballon d'Or]] were announced. Barcelona players took all three spots. Messi, Xavi, and Iniesta will discover which one of them is the world's best player on 10 January in Zurich, Switzerland. This will be a monumental moment for FC Barcelona, as the three best players in the world will not only be from the club, but all three will have come from Barcelona's youth system.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/destacades/n101206114432.html |title=2010 FIFA ballon d'Or|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2010-12-06|accessdate=2010-12-06}} On 13 December, president Rosell made final the signing of a 5Â½ years, â¬170 million shirt sponsorship with the [[Qatar Foundation]] thus ending BarÃ§a's tradition of not having paid sponsors on their shirt.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/club/temporada10-11/12/13/n101213114565.html|title=BarÃ§a reach shirt sponsorship agreement with Qatar Foundation|language=Spanish|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2010-12-13|accessdate=2010-12-13}} The deal makes it the highest paid shirt sponsorship in the world, beating both [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United's]] deal with [[Aon Corporation|Aon]] and [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool's]] deal with [[Standard Chartered]] reached last year.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=851327&sec=europe&cc=5901|title=Highest shirt sponsorship deals|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2010-12-10|accessdate=2010-12-13}} ===January=== On 10 January, Lionel Messi was crowned the [[2010 FIFA Ballon d'Or]] winner in [[Zurich]], [[Switzerland]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/destacades/n110110115026.html|title=Messi wins 2010 FIFA Ballon d'Or|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-01-10|accessdate=2011-01-10}} His team-mates Iniesta and Xavi finished second and third, respectively. Messi became the first player to win the new prize after the [[FIFA World Player of the Year]] and [[Ballon d'Or]] merged to become the [[FIFA Ballon d'Or]]. Messi became the first player since [[Marco van Basten]] to win the Ballon d'Or and [[Ronaldinho]] the FIFA World Player of the Year in consecutive years after an impressive year where he tallied 60 goals in 64 games.{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/foxsoccer/europe/story/lionel-messi-claims-fifa-golden-ball-award|title=Messi goals for 2010|publisher=FOXSoccer.com|date=2011-01-10|accessdate=2011-01-10}} On 19 January, BarÃ§a's team record of 28 matches unbeaten streak was ended after going down 3â1 against [[Real Betis]] of the [[2010â11 Segunda DivisiÃ³n|Segunda DivisiÃ³n]] in the second leg of their quarter-finals tie of the [[2010â11 Copa del Rey|Copa del Rey]]. Barcelona however advanced to the semi-finals on a 6â3 aggregate score after winning the first leg at the Camp Nou with a scoreline of 5â0.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/copa_rei/quarts/jornada02/Betis_Barcelona/partit.html|title=Betis ends BarÃ§a's unbeaten run|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-01-19|accessdate=2011-01-20}} On 29 January, BarÃ§a defeated HÃ©rcules 0â3 to match the record for most consecutive league wins in a La Liga season, at 15. The record was previously set by [[Real Madrid]] during the [[1960â61 La Liga|1960-61 season]].{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/sports/soccer/news/_/id/6071715/barcelona-ties-real-madrid-record-15th-consecutive-league-win|title=Barcelona ties consecutive wins record|publisher=espn.com|date=2011-01-29|accessdate=2011-01-29}} ===February=== On 2 February, both Barcelona and Real Madrid advanced to the [[2011 Copa del Rey Final|Final]] of the [[2010-11 Copa del Rey|Copa del Rey]] by defeating AlmerÃ­a (8-0 on aggregate{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/copa_rei/semifinals/jornada02/Almeria_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a eliminates AlmerÃ­a|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-02-02|accessdate=2011-02-02}}) and Sevilla (0-3 on aggregate{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330039544682/noticia/Cronica/Real_Madrid_2-0_Sevilla.htm|title=Real Madrid eliminates Sevilla|publisher=Realmadrid.com|date=2011-02-02|accessdate=2011-02-02}}), respectively. This will be the first final between the Spanish giants after 21 years in the making when the clubs last faced in 1990 with BarÃ§a winning 2â0 at the [[Estadio Mestalla|Mestalla]] in [[Valencia, Spain|Valencia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rfef.es/index.jsp?nodo=124&CATEGORIA=2&ID=1167|title=El ClÃ¡sico re-appears in the Copa del Rey final|publisher=RFEF.es|language=Spanish|date=2011-02-02|accessdate=2011-02-02}} On 5 February, Barcelona broke the record for most consecutive league wins with 16 victories after they defeated AtlÃ©tico Madrid 3â0 at the Camp Nou.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/02/05/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1296946785.html|title=BarÃ§a set 16 wins consecutive league wins|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date=2011-02-05|accessdate=2011-02-05}} Lionel Messi scored a hat-trick to ensure the victory for his side and after the match he stated, "it's an honor to be able to pass a record set by a great like [[Alfredo Di StÃ©fano|Di StÃ©fano]]" and "if the record has been around for so long is because it's very complicated to achieve and we have reached it by defeating a very difficult team who's going through a bad situation, which makes it even more difficult."{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/02/06/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1296948365.html|title=Messi talks about the record|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date=2011-02-05|accessdate=2011-02-05}} ===March=== On 2 March, [[Adriano Correia|Adriano]] assisted Lionel Messi to score a late goal and give Barcelona a 0â1 away win against Valencia. Messi has now tallied 27 goals in La Liga for the season keeping him in the running for the [[Pichichi Trophy]] as top scorer.{{cite web|url=http://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2011/3/2/2025958/valencia-cf-vs-fc-barcelona-lionel-messi-goal-puts-blaugranes-ahead|title=Messi keeps scoring.|publisher=SBNation.com|date=2011-03-03|accessdate=2011-03-03}} On 8 March, BarÃ§a eliminated [[Arsenal FC|Arsenal]] from the Champions League in a 3â1 win at the Camp Nou with a 4â3 aggregate score. Barcelona dominated all offensive categories and limited Arsenal to zero shots for the whole match with their lone goal coming off an [[own goal]] by [[Sergio Busquets]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/03/09/n110309116187.html|title=BarÃ§a eliminate Arsenal.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-03-09|accessdate=2011-03-09}} But the match was not without controversy after Arsenal [[Forward (association football)|forward]] [[Robin van Persie]] was [[Ejection (sports)#Association football|sent off]] for a second [[Penalty card|yellow card]] for what referee [[Massimo Busacca]] interpreted as ''time wasting'' after the player kicked the ball towards goal after the referee had blown the whistle on him for being called [[Offside (association football)|offside]] by the [[Assistant referee (association football)|linesman]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1364390/Arsenal-vent-anger-ref-Massimo-Busacca-Robin-Van-Persie-red-card.html|title=Controversial sending off.|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|date=2011-03-09|accessdate=2011-03-09|location=London|first=Laura|last=Williamson}} On 14 March, Spanish radio station [[Cadena COPE]] reported that Real Madrid would request for the [[Royal Spanish Football Federation]] (RFEF) to tighten its control on doping in the league. According to the report, Real Madrid was suspicious to why [[Eufemiano Fuentes]] was allowed to work for Valencia when they won the league in the early 2000s and why are doctors with ''doubtful reputation'' working at Barcelona.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/03/14/futbol/equipos/real_madrid/1300061219.html|title=COPE implicates BarÃ§a in doping.|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date=2011-03-14|accessdate=2011-03-15}} Barcelona in defence released a statement "publicly expressing its total indignation at these unfounded references which link the club to doping practices and to condemn such attitudes, which have nothing to do with fair play and gravely affect the image of sporting competition." It also stated "its legal department is studying possible legal action to defend the clubâs honour, alongside that of its coaching staff, players and medical staff and is prepared to take such action to its final consequences."{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/club/temporada10-11/03/14/n110314116288.html|title=BarÃ§a response to doping allegations|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-03-14|accessdate=2011-03-15}} COPE later on issued an apology stating "our objective is to inform. In no case, did we participate in a campaign to defame or bring doubts to Spanish clubs or athletes."{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/03/14/futbol/1adivision/1300132525.html|title=COPE apologizes for report.|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date=2011-03-14|accessdate=2011-03-15}} On 15 March, Barcelona's Secretary and Spokesperson [[Toni Freixa]] appeared in a press conference to make public that Barcelona will sue Cadena COPE after the reports implicating Barcelona in doping. He stated that "yesterday [14 March], FC Barcelona released a statement and, paralleled, sent a fax to Cadena COPE requesting the rectification and the origin of the grave report of defamation. The rest of the day it waited for the express and convincing rectification of the report." He also added "since this correction has not occurred satisfactorily and whether they can finally be produced, for the serious attack on the reputation and good name of FC Barcelona, for their athletes and doctors, a fact that we cannot leave unpunished, FC Barcelona announced to act with firmness and force that the gravity of the offense deserves. In the coming days it will request at first instance with the Barcelona's courts a order of protection of their right to honor claims for damages caused by those responsible for defamation."{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/club/temporada10-11/03/15/n110315116306.html|title=Barcelona's response to doping claims.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|language=Spanish|date=2011-03-15|accessdate=2011-03-15}} On the same day, Barcelona announced that [[France national football team|French international]] [[Defender (association football)|defender]] [[Ãric Abidal]] was diagnosed with a tumour on his liver which would be operated on the Friday of the same week. Citing privacy concerns as wished by the player, the club did not release additional information in regards to his condition.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/03/15/n110315116321.html|title=Abidal diagnosed with tumour on liver.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-03-15|accessdate=2011-03-16}} In response to the announcement, players and fans from all over the wold alike dedicated well wishes for the ill player on multiple [[social networking sites]] and sports websites.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/894640/barcelona-defender-eric-abidal-to-undergo-surgery-on-liver-tumour?cc=5901|title=Well wishes for Abidal.|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-03-15|accessdate=2011-03-16}}{{cite web|url=http://www.elmundodeportivo.es/gen/20110315/54128249124/noticia/el-mundo-del-deporte-se-vuelca-con-abidal.html|title=Well wishes for Abidal.|publisher=elmundodeportivo.es|language=Spanish|date=2011-03-15|accessdate=2011-03-16}} Before their [[2010-11 UEFA Champions League#Round of 16|Round of 16]] match in the Champions League both Real Madrid and [[Olympique Lyonnais]] players exited onto the pitch wearing ''Ãnimo Abidal'' (Strength Abidal) t-shirts along with the same message on the [[Santiago BernabÃ©u Stadium|Santiago BernabÃ©u's]] scoreboards in show of support and solidarity.{{cite web|url=http://sport.es/default.asp?idpublicacio_PK=44&idioma=CAS&idtipusrecurs_PK=7&idnoticia_PK=739196|title=Well wishes for Abidal.|publisher=Sport.es|language=Spanish|date=2011-03-16|accessdate=2011-03-16}}{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/03/16/futbol/equipos/real_madrid/1300304703.html|title=Well wishes for Abidal.|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date=2011-03-16|accessdate=2011-03-16}} ===April=== On 2 April, Barcelona defeated [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] 1â0 at [[El Madrigal]] with five missing starters due to injuries and rest with a goal in the 66th minute from [[Defender (association football)#Centre back|centre back]] [[Gerard PiquÃ©]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada30/Villarreal_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a defeat Villarreal.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-04-02|accessdate=2011-04-03}} With the victory, they increased their league lead to 8 points after Real Madrid's 1â0 shock loss to [[Sporting de GijÃ³n|Sporting GijÃ³n]] at the Santiago BernabÃ©u.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/tables/_/league/esp.1/spanish-la-liga?cc=5901|title=Table after Round 30.|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-04-03|accessdate=2011-04-03}} On 12 April, Barcelona defeated [[Shakhtar Donetsk]] 0â1 at the [[Donbass Arena]] in [[Donetsk, Ukraine]] to reach their 4th consecutive semi-finals appearance in the [[UEFA Champions League]] with a 6â1 aggregate score.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/champions_league/quarts/jornada02/Shakhtar_Donetsk_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a defeat Shakhtar.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-04-12|2011-04-12}} Lionel Messi assured the victory with a goal in the 43rd minute to take his season tally to 48 goals in all competitions, breaking the club's mark of 47 goals set by himself [[2009â10 FC Barcelona season|last season]] and [[Ronaldo]] in the [[1996â97 La Liga|1996-1997]] season.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/04/12/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1302638542.html|title=Messi sets new BarÃ§a goal record.|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date=2011-04-12|accessdate=2011-04-12}} On 16 April, the first of four ClÃ¡sicos was disputed at the BernabÃ©u, ending in 1â1 with penalty goals respectively by Lionel Messi (53rd minute) and [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] (82nd minute).{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada32/Madrid_Barcelona/partit.html|title=ClÃ¡sico ends in a draw.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-04-16|accessdate=2011-04-16}} The draw ended Barcelona's ClÃ¡sico streak at 5 wins since manager Pep Guardiola took over the side for the [[2008â09 FC Barcelona season|2008-09 season]]. The match was the start of four ClÃ¡sicos between the two Spanish giants, including the league, Copa del Rey Final and the semi-finals of the Champions League.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/906483/barcelona's-pep-guardiola-relishing-prospect-of-real-madrid-series?cc=5901|title=Pep relishes ClÃ¡sico series.|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-04-13|accessdate=2011-04-16}} On 20 April, Barcelona lost the final of the Copa del Rey to Real Madrid 0â1 after extra time with Cristiano Ronaldo scoring the winning goal in the 103rd minute.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/copa_rei/final/jornada01/Barcelona_Madrid/partit.html|title=CdR goes to Real Madrid|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-04-20|accessdate=2011-04-21}} The defeat was a first for Guardiola in a finals match and ended his unbeaten streak against Real Madrid since he became first team coach.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/04/21/n110421117027.html|title=Guardiola loses first final|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-04-21|accessdate=2011-04-21}} On 27 April, Barcelona and Real Madrid met at the Santiago BernabÃ©u in [[Madrid]] for the first leg of their Champions League semi-final tie. Although Barcelona enjoyed most of the possession throughout the first half of the game, it wasn't until the sending off of Real Madrid's [[Pepe (footballer born 1983)|Pepe]] that the game swung to Barcelona's favor with Lionel Messi scoring twice in the closing minutes to give Barcelona a 2â0 first-leg victory.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/champions_league/semifinals/jornada01/Madrid_Barcelona/partit.html|title=Real Madrid 0-2 Barcelona|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-04-27|accessdate=2011-04-28}} With these 2 goals, Lionel Messi now has 11 goals in 11 Champions League games and is threatening to set the all-time Champions League record of 14 goals.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/statistics/index.html|title=Messi top scorer|publisher=[[UEFA]].com|date=2011-04-27|accessdate=2011-04-28}} The match was not without controversy as both teams exhibited what most consider to be the ''dark arts'' of football.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/columns/story/_/id/912767/lionel-messi-and-jose-mourinho-mask-barcelona-shame?cc=5901|title=El ClÃ¡sico marred by unsportsmanlike behavior|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-04-27|accessdate=2011-04-28}} Real Madrid manager [[JosÃ© Mourinho]] accused [[UEFA]] of playing favorites to Barcelona after he was ejected for mocking the 4th official after Pepe's red card. At the press conference following the match, Mourinho stated that UEFA's referees have been assisting Barcelona for the past three years.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/912532/mourinho:-barcelona-have-knocked-us-out?cc=5901|title=Mourinho rants at press conference|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-04-27|accessdate=2011-04-28}} Barcelona's back-up goalkeeper [[JosÃ© Manuel Pinto]] saw a red card at half-time for a scuffle with Real Madrid's defender [[Ãlvaro Arbeloa]] when both teams went to the locker rooms. The match was marred by more incidents of diving, play-acting and violence in what many consider to be one of the worst ClÃ¡sicos in recent times. UEFA officials released a statement stating they have opened disciplinary cases against the clubs to be heard by the UEFA Control and Disciplinary Body on Friday 6 May.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefa/footballfirst/matchorganisation/disciplinary/news/newsid=1624556.html#disciplinary+cases+opened+against+real+madrid+barcelona|title=UEFA opens disciplinary actions against both semifinalist|publisher=[[UEFA]].com|date=2011-04-28|accessdate=2011-04-28}} On 30 April, Barcelona's 32-games unbeaten run came to an end after a 2â1 loss to [[Real Sociedad]] at [[Estadio Anoeta|Anoeta]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada34/Real_Sociedad_Barcelona/partit.html|title=Real Sociedad takes down BarÃ§a|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-04-30|accessdate=2011-05-03}} ===May=== On 3 May, Barcelona booked a trip to [[Wembley Stadium]] for the [[2011 UEFA Champions League Final|UEFA Champions League Final]] after a 1â1 draw (3â1 aggregate) with Real Madrid at Camp Nou. Barcelona's forward [[Pedro RodrÃ­guez Ledesma|Pedro]] sealed it with a 54th minute goal and thus insuring the progress for his club.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/champions_league/semifinals/jornada02/Barcelona_Madrid/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a advances to Wembley|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-05-03|accessdate=2011-05-03}} On 11 May, Barcelona clinched its third consecutive La Liga title with a 1â1 draw against [[Levante UD|Levante]] at the [[Estadi Ciutat de ValÃ¨ncia|Ciutat de ValÃ¨ncia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada36/Levante_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a wins 3rd consecutive La Liga.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-05-11|accessdate=2011-05-11}} The result gave Barcelona a 6 point lead with two matches remaining which, combined with their better head-to-head record with Real Madrid, ensured that they finished top of the table.{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/SPORT/football/05/11/football.barcelona.messi.madrid/?hpt=T2|title=Barcelona crowned Spanish champions after Levante draw|publisher=[[CNN]] International|date=2011-05-11|accessdate=2011-05-14}} Barcelona led the table since defeating Madrid 5â0 back in November and since then, they've only lost one match en route to winning the title.{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/3277/la-liga/2011/05/11/2482177/barcelona-win-2010-11-la-liga-title|title=Barcelona win 2010-11 La Liga title|publisher=[[Goal.com]]|date=2011-05-11|accessdate=2011-05-14}} It was the third straight title for manager Guardiola, who became the first manager to do so in his first three seasons managing in La Liga.{{cite news|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/dcunited/barcelona-wins-3rd-straight-spanish-league-title-after-drawing-1-1-at-levante/2011/05/11/AFIyKRrG_story.html|title=Barcelona wins 3rd straight Spanish league title after drawing 1-1 at Levante|publisher=WashingtonPost.com|date=2011-05-11|accessdate=2011-05-14}} On 21 May, Barcelona finish its league season with a win 1â3 over [[MÃ¡laga CF|MÃ¡laga]] at [[Estadio La Rosaleda|La Rosaleda]] while playing most of the back-up and [[cantera]]no players.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada38/Malaga_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a finish league with win|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-05-21|accessdate=2011-05-21}} Goals from [[Bojan KrkiÄ|Bojan]], [[Ibrahim Afellay|Afellay]] and [[Marc Bartra|Bartra]] assured the victory and a club record of 14 away victories.{{cite web|url=http://www.sport.es/es/noticias/barca/20110521/barca-supero-record-victorias-domicilio/1014378.shtml|title=BarÃ§a sets new away wins record|publisher=Sport.es|language=Spanish|date=2011-05-21|accessdate=2011-05-21}} On 28 May, Barcelona clinched its fourth Champions League trophy with a 3â1 victory over [[Manchester United]] at Wembley Stadium. The Barcelona attack, spearheaded by its three forwards of Messi, David Villa and Pedro, of whom all scored a goal, dominated United.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/futbol/temporada_10-11/arxiu_partits/champions_league/final/jornada01/Barcelona_Manchester/partit.html|title=Barcelona win the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]]|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-05-28|accessdate=2011-05-28}} Messi was awarded Man of the Match{{cite web|url=http://www.sport.es/es/noticias/barca/20110528/leo-messi-elegido-mejor-jugador-del-partido/1023581.shtml|title=Messi wins Man of the Match|publisher=Sport.es|language=Spanish|date=2011-05-28|accessdate=2011-05-28}} and with his goal he matches [[Ruud van Nistelrooy]] as the all-time top season scorer with 12 goals in this years version.{{cite web|url=http://en.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=1634951.html#top+scorer+messi+matches+van+nistelrooy+mark|title=Messi matches all-time season
